intro: Diabelia stenophylla var. wenzhouensis, commonly known as the Wenzhou diabelia, is a rare variant of the diabelia species native to China. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family, characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, such as mountainous regions. Its botanical features include hairy stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
